item.title: General Questions
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description:
Where are you now? Barcelona, Spain What are you doing in BCN? Second half of my double Master’s. What then, after the double Master’s? I’m currently applying for my PhD, I hope to go back to the UK, or perhaps stay in Europe. If all things failed, I shall go back to China (and see…
Read more
item.content:encoded:
1. Where are you now? Barcelona, Spain
  2. What are you doing in BCN? Second half of my double Master’s.
  3. What then, after the double Master’s? I’m currently applying for my PhD, I hope to go back to the UK, or perhaps stay in Europe. If all things failed, I shall go back to China (and see if I can hack into any university).
  4. Do you like Spain or the UK? Big question. Buy me a drink (not merely a beer) and I will tell you.
  5. Do you miss the UK? Yes.
  6. Do you miss China? Yes.
  7. What do you do in your leisure time? Define leisure.
  8. Ok, but apart from philosophising, what do you do? Erm. Not-philosophising? But this itself is a way of philosophising. We might want to be more specific about what we mean by philosophising.
  9. What music do you listen to? I do cheesy pop (more english than Chinese) – judge away, some instrumental jazz, some classical.
  10. Favourite TV show? Favourite is a strong word.
  11. Ok what TV show do you watch now? Currently on top of my head: Mozart in the Jungle1, GoT S7, How to Get Away with Murders, Grand Tour, Various Panel / Non-Panel shows in the UK, Madam Secretary, Scandal, Uehiro Lectures (I know.)
  12. Your presentations are so cool, what do you use? Keynote.
  13. But my keynote doesn’t do the same as yours… Upgrade it.
  14. What’s the best way to reach me? iMessage and Email.
  1. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mozart_in_the_Jungle

item.title: Getting Political Philosophy Books
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description:
I can help you (to the best of my ability) to get access to political philosophy books. Couple caveats: Sometimes books are not free, I will have to pay some money too. I don’t mind paying for you first, but you have to pay me back later. Trust is important. I don’t make money on…
Read more
item.content:encoded:
I can help you (to the best of my ability) to get access to political philosophy books.

Couple caveats:

  1. Sometimes books are not free, I will have to pay some money too. I don’t mind paying for you first, but you have to pay me back later. Trust is important.
  2. I don’t make money on this.
  3. You can use it for journal articles unless you cannot get it using 1) university log-in; 2) sci-hub. (If I get access using either of this method you’ll be banned for good).
  4. I will get you the PDF of the book (no hard-copy what-not).
  5. Turnaround is normally 24 hour, but I make no promise.
  6. You can submit in but, but one-book-per-line, please.
  7. Format: Book name (space) author (e.g., Morality of Freedom Joseph Raz)
[contact-form-7]

item.title: MUN
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description:
Where did the MUN section on your website go? As I am no longer active in MUN (not sure if that’s “retirement”), MUN seizes to be a big part of my life. Archive posts, however can still be accessed here: vpchris.com/mun What about your edited Rules and Procedures? Still available (though I have not update…
Read more
item.content:encoded:
1. Where did the MUN section on your website go? As I am no longer active in MUN (not sure if that’s “retirement”), MUN seizes to be a big part of my life. Archive posts, however can still be accessed here: vpchris.com/mun
  2. What about your edited Rules and Procedures? Still available (though I have not update it at all), just drop me a line. But there is no reason why you should rely on my RoP as there are so many great and updated RoPs out there!
  3. Can I still invite you to a conference? Sure, but make sure it’s a good one.
  4. Can I see your MUN CV? Here
  5. Should I go into MUN? Perhaps a bit biased: definitely.
  6. But my english is bad, I’m not sure. Tough luck that you’re reading this.
  7. But I don’t want a political career. Yeah sure all MUNers ended up being presidents for their countries. (Not)
  8. Should I represent my own country? No.
